Name: Levothyroxine (Synthroid, Levoxyl, Unithroid, Tirosint)
Dosage: 50 mcg daily (initial dose for many adults, adjusted based on individual needs and blood tests)
Usage: Treating or preventing goiter (enlarged thyroid gland)
Managing certain types of thyroid cancer

Common Side Effects: Hair loss (especially in children during the first few months of therapy)
Uncommon Side Effects: Severe allergic reactions (rash, itching/swelling, severe dizziness, trouble breathing)
Dizziness or fainting (signs of adrenal gland problems)
